About Sun Times in Houston

Houston, TX is located at coordinates 29.7604°N, -95.3698°W in the America/Denver timezone. With a population of 2,320,268 and an elevation of 371 feet, this location offers unique viewing conditions. The local geography and urban layout create distinctive opportunities for sunrise and sunset photography.

Located at 29.76° latitude, Houston has relatively stable day lengths year-round with gentle seasonal variations. This makes Houston an excellent location for both sunrise and sunset photography throughout the year.

The city's elevation of 371 feet above sea level creates unique viewing conditions that photographers and outdoor enthusiasts appreciate.

📸 Photography Tips for Houston

For sunrise and sunset photography in Houston, position yourself with clear views to the west. Arrive 30-45 minutes before sunrise or sunset for the best golden hour lighting. Use a tripod for sharp images during low light conditions, and experiment with different compositions including foreground elements.

Golden Hour in Houston: Golden hour in Houston occurs approximately one hour before sunset and one hour after sunrise, providing the warm, soft lighting that photographers prize. This timing varies slightly throughout the year based on seasonal sun angle changes.

Best Photography Months: The optimal months for sunrise and sunset photography in Houston are April, May, September, October. During these periods, you'll experience the most favorable weather conditions and lighting.

Equipment Recommendations: For the best results, bring a tripod for sharp images during low light conditions. A wide-angle lens can capture the expansive sky, while a telephoto lens is perfect for isolating the sun against interesting foreground elements.

🗓️ Seasonal Variations

At 29.7604° latitude, Houston experiences noticeable seasonal changes in sunrise and sunset times. Summer days are significantly longer than winter days, providing varied opportunities for photography throughout the year.

Understanding these seasonal changes helps in planning photography sessions and outdoor activities. The dramatic difference between summer and winter sun times offers diverse photographic opportunities throughout the year.
